Series VII: Trials and Legal Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records

The first subseries is the most substantial; it documents several notable trials involving members of the CPUSA and associated individuals and organizations who were prosecuted under the 1940 Smith Act, including Joseph Brandt, Eugene Dennis (also represented by his trial for contempt of court, arising from his Smith Act trial), Elizabeth Gurley Flynn, and Stephen Mesarosh (Steve Nelson). Many cases began at the local or state level and progressed to the federal court system. Transcripts, trial exhibits, and background research for several of these cases are available here. Of particular interest are two boxes of index cards which provide biographical information on a number of individuals who acted as government witnesses, as well as details about the cases in which they gave testimony.
